excerpt: Lively indoor market featuring food, crafts & souvenir vendors, plus informal bars & restaurants.
detail_description: Mercado Central de Belo Horizonte is a bustling indoor market that offers a vibrant mix of food, crafts, and souvenir vendors alongside casual bars and restaurants. This modern city boasts a rich architectural heritage, including the Pampulha Modern Ensemble and Obras de Oscar Niemeyer.
name: Mercado Central de Belo Horizonte
address: Av. Augusto de Lima, 744 - Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30190-922, Brazil

detail_description: Praça da Liberdade, located in the heart of the city, is a spacious plaza surrounded by lush parks and significant government buildings such as the Palacio do Governo and a public library. The area also features architectural marvels like the Art Deco style Palacio Cristo Rio and Edificio Niemeyer, an iconic curved apartment building. Visitors can take leisurely strolls under the shade of trees, admire vibrant flowers, and relax by charming fountains.
name: Praça da Liberdade
address: Savassi, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30140-010, Brazil

excerpt: Modern performing arts complex hosting a range of productions, including opera, theater & concerts.
detail_description: Palácio das Artes is a striking modern performing arts complex located in Belo Horizonte. Designed by Oscar Niemeyer, it houses the Fundacao Clovis Salgado and offers a range of artistic experiences. The complex includes three theaters hosting concerts, dance performances, theater, and operas. Additionally, visitors can explore three art galleries showcasing various exhibitions.
name: Palácio das Artes
address: Av. Afonso Pena, 1537 - Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30120-010, Brazil

excerpt: Sedate, residential Pampulha borders Lagoa da Pampulha, a vast artificial lake. On its shores, the Museu de Arte da Pampulha, with Brazilian art, the Capela Curial de São Francisco de Assis church, and the Casa do Baile gallery were all designed by Oscar Niemeyer. Yemanja Square has a metal portal and a statue honoring an African water deity. Carlos Drummond de Andrade Airport services only noncommercial flights.
detail_description: Pampulha is a tranquil residential area located along the shores of Lagoa da Pampulha, an expansive artificial lake. This neighborhood is home to several architectural wonders designed by Oscar Niemeyer, such as the Museu de Arte da Pampulha, Capela Curial de São Francisco de Assis church, and Casa do Baile gallery. Yemanja Square features a striking metal portal and a statue dedicated to an African water deity.
name: Pampulha
address: Belo Horizonte - State of Minas Gerais, Brazil

excerpt: Lively Savassi draws evening crowds to its laid-back bars with sidewalk tables and eateries serving regional Minas Gerais specialties or global cuisine. Praça da Liberdade is a green square centered on a palm-lined path. It’s overlooked by imposing buildings, including the wave-like Edifício Niemeyer, the Memorial Minas Gerais Vale mining museum, and the Bank of Brazil Cultural Center, hosting art, film, and theater.
detail_description: Savassi is a vibrant neighborhood in the heart of the city, known for its lively evening scene with laid-back bars and eateries offering local specialties and global cuisine. The area features Praça da Liberdade, a green square surrounded by impressive buildings such as the wave-like Edifício Niemeyer, Memorial Minas Gerais Vale mining museum, and Bank of Brazil Cultural Center.
name: Savassi
address: Belo Horizonte - State of Minas Gerais, Brazil

excerpt: Accessible by driving or hiking, this observation point offers sweeping views of the city & sunset.
detail_description: Mirante do Mangabeiras, located in Belo Horizonte, is a popular observation point that offers stunning panoramic views of the city and its surroundings. Initially established in 1976, it has evolved into a significant tourist attraction over the years. Accessible by both driving and hiking, this elevated site provides an ideal vantage point for capturing breathtaking sunset vistas and urban landscapes.
name: Mirante do Mangabeiras
address: R. Pedro José Pardo, 1000 - Mangabeiras, Belo Horizonte - MG, 47512-000, Brazil

excerpt: Neoclassical 19th-century palace with guided tours of the lavish interiors & a landscaped garden.
detail_description: Palácio da Liberdade is a neoclassical 19th-century palace in Belo Horizonte, offering guided tours of its lavish interiors and a landscaped garden. The Casa Fiat de Cultura has moved to the Palacio dos Despachos, part of the same architectural complex. This move allowed for the restoration of historical buildings and significant artworks, including Candido Portinari's 'Civilizacao Mineira.'
name: Palácio da Liberdade
address: Praça da Liberdade, s/nº - Funcionários, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30140-010, Brazil

excerpt: Museum with interactive exhibits about the mining history & culture of the state of Minas Gerais.
detail_description: Located in Belo Horizonte, Memorial Minas Gerais Vale is an innovative museum that offers interactive exhibits showcasing the rich mining history and culture of the state of Minas Gerais. Housed in a grand building at Liberty Square Circuit, the museum presents a comprehensive journey through the cultural richness of Minas Gerais from the 18th century to contemporary times.
name: Memorial Minas Gerais Vale
address: Esquina com, Praça da Liberdade, R. Gonçalves Dias, 640 - Savassi, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30320-900, Brazil

excerpt: Sprawling public park with sports fields & courts, playgrounds, trails & performance spaces.
detail_description: Municipal Park of Mangabeiras is a vast urban park in Belo Horizonte, Brazil, offering a range of recreational activities. It features sports fields, playgrounds, and trails for outdoor enthusiasts. The park also includes performance spaces and picnic areas amidst natural forests, making it an ideal destination for nature lovers. With its scenic views framed by the Curral mountains and modern skyline, the park provides a perfect setting to admire the city's beauty.
name: Municipal Park of Mangabeiras
address: Av. José do Patrocínio Pontes, 580 - Mangabeiras, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30210-090, Brazil

excerpt: Main city square & popular green space, surrounded by museums & historic buildings.
detail_description: Praça da Liberdade, also known as Liberty Square, is a vibrant cultural hub and popular green space in Belo Horizonte. It is surrounded by museums, historic buildings, and government offices that have been converted into the Praça da Liberdade Cultural Complex. This complex houses nine museums and galleries including the Metal Museum, Memorial Minas Gerais Vale, Mines Museum, Bank of Brazil Cultural Centre, and the iconic Niemeyer Building.
name: Praça da Liberdade
address: s/n - Funcionários, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30140-010, Brazil

excerpt: Giant stadium built in 1965, featuring football games plus a museum & dining options.
detail_description: Mineirão Stadium, situated in Belo Horizonte, Brazil, is a must-see for sports enthusiasts and football aficionados. This colossal stadium was constructed in 1965 and has become one of the country's largest sporting venues. With a seating capacity exceeding 60,000 spectators, it serves as the home ground for renowned football clubs Atletico Mineiro and Cruzeiro Esporte Clube.
name: Estádio Governador Magalhães Pinto
address: Av. Antônio Abrahão Caram, 1001 - São José, Belo Horizonte - MG, 31275-000, Brazil

excerpt: Exhibits focused on the area's history housed in an old mansion, with a restaurant & public square.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant city of Belo Horizonte, the Museu Histórico Abílio Barreto is a captivating destination for history enthusiasts. Inaugurated on February 18, 1943, this museum was established to honor historian Abílio Barreto and showcases the rich tapestry of the city's past. Housed within an elegant colonial mansion that once served as a pig farm, it features both permanent and temporary exhibitions that chronicle Belo Horizonte's transformation from a modest mining town to a bustling metropolis.
name: Museu Histórico Abílio Barreto
address: Av. Prudente de Morais, 202 - Cidade Jardim, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30380-002, Brazil

detail_description: Located in the heart of BH, Parque Municipal de Belo Horizonte is a traditional park offering entertainment for children with its playground and toy options. On Sundays, visitors can also explore a market featuring various food, arts, and crafts. The park features a scenic lagoon and a train that operates on weekends. While the park provides a refreshing touch of nature in the city center, some visitors feel that it could benefit from better maintenance.
name: Parque Municipal de Belo Horizonte
address: Av. Afonso Pena, 1377 - Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30130-002, Brazil

detail_description: Parque Municipal Américo Renné Giannetti - Portaria Afonso Pena/Escadaria is a spacious park located near a hippy market, offering a peaceful escape in the bustling center of Belo Horizonte. With extended opening hours, it's ideal for activities like hiking and cycling, providing a cooler climate with its dense tree cover and lakes. The park also features an amusement park and theater, making it suitable for visitors of all ages.
name: Parque Municipal Américo Renné Giannetti - Portaria Afonso Pena/Escadaria
address: Av. Afonso Pena, 1055 - Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30130-002, Brazil

detail_description: Parque das Mangabeiras - Portaria Caraça is a stunning mountainous area that offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city during the day and a mesmerizing sunset experience. It features Mirante das Mangabeiras and Praca do Papa, where Pope John Paul II held Mass in 1980. The park provides ample space for leisure activities such as picnics, long walks, and biking sessions.
name: Parque das Mangabeiras - Portaria Caraça
address: Estr. da Ferrobel, 90A - Marçola, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30220-262, Brazil

excerpt: Modern, immersive mining museum featuring a replica mine & many samples of regional metals & gems.
detail_description: The Mm Gerdau Museum of Mines and Metal in Minas Gerais, Brazil is a modern, immersive museum featuring a replica mine & many samples of regional metals & gems. It's well known for its role in exploring the nature to export metals all around the world. The museum is kid-friendly and has an attendant who can explain and show rocks from all different surfaces. There are also shops near the cafeteria selling different types of rocks.
name: MM Gerdau – Museum Of Mines And Metal
address: Praça da Liberdade, 680 - Funcionários, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30140-010, Brazil

excerpt: Catholic church dating to 1902, with a striped facade, colorfully patterned nave & biblical murals.
detail_description: The shrine of Santuário São José is a beautiful church located in the heart of Belo Horizonte. It is open to everyone and its biblical murals are worth seeing. The inside of the church is decorated with angels and other holy images, making St. Joseph stand out prominently. This place is a oasis in the middle of the busy city and it can be recommended for people who want to rest, pray and admire some beautiful artwork.
name: Santuário São José
address: Rua dos Tupis, 164 - Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30190-060, Brazil

detail_description: Igreja Batista da Lagoinha, also known as the Baptist Church of the Pond, may appear massive in online visuals, but it is actually relatively small with three circular floors. Visitors often express a deep connection to the presence of Jesus Christ within its walls and describe it as an incredible place to seek God's voice and worship. The church has garnered high praise for its spiritual atmosphere and is highly regarded by those who have experienced it firsthand.
name: Igreja Batista da Lagoinha
address: Rua Araribá, 430 - Concórdia, Belo Horizonte - MG, 31210-700, Brazil

excerpt: This massive artificial lake is ringed by noted institutions, including a Niemeyer-designed church.
detail_description: Lagoa da Pampulha is a massive artificial lake surrounded by notable institutions, including a Niemeyer-designed church. It's located just 20 minutes away from downtown and can be easily accessed by MOVE.
name: Lagoa da Pampulha
address: Av. Otacílio Negrão de Lima, s/n - São Luiz, Belo Horizonte - MG, 31365-450, Brazil

excerpt: Public green space with a wooden playground & lawns for picnicking, known for city views at sunset.
detail_description: Praça Governador Israel Pinheiro, also known as Praça do Papa, is a public green space in Belo Horizonte that offers stunning city views at sunset. The square is an architectural ensemble featuring neoclassical and post-modern buildings set in Versailles-inspired gardens. It is famous for being the location where Pope John Paul II held Mass in 1980.
name: Praça Governador Israel Pinheiro (Praça do Papa)
address: Av. Agulhas Negras, s/n - Mangabeiras, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30210-060, Brazil

excerpt: Designed by architect Oscar Neimeyer, this building on a manmade island hosts temporary exhibits.
detail_description: Casa do Baile, a circular building designed by architects Oscar Niemeyer and Roberto Burle Marx, is located on a man-made island in Pampulha Lagoon. Originally a dance hall built in 1943, it was renovated and reopened in 2002 to house various art exhibits and host multimedia events. Visitors can also enjoy the popular cafe/restaurant with waterfront views.
name: Casa do Baile
address: Av. Otacílio Negrão de Lima, 751 - Pampulha, Belo Horizonte - MG, 31365-450, Brazil

excerpt: Museum of Brazilian art, best known for its gardens & modernist architecture by Oscar Niemeyer.
detail_description: The Pampulha Art Museum, also known as the Cassino da Pampulha, is a prominent feature of the Pampulha Modern Ensemble in Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais, Brazil. Designed by renowned architect Oscar Niemeyer, this museum was originally a casino that brought life to the city's nightlife. It is part of a collection of buildings recognized by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site.
name: Pampulha Museum of Art (MAP)
address: Av. Otacílio Negrão de Lima, 16585 - Pampulha, Belo Horizonte - MG, 31365-450, Brazil

excerpt: Charming spot with Brazilian artwork, serving Minas-style spare ribs & trout in champagne sauce.
detail_description: Casa dos Contos is a traditional à la carte restaurant in Belo Horizonte, known for its charming ambiance and colorful walls adorned with artwork from various artists. The menu features classic dishes like File Surprise, Parmegiana, and Brazilian-style filet with delicious sides like banana milanesa. The restaurant is popular among local artists and offers a variety of options including Minas-style spare ribs and trout in champagne sauce.
name: Casa dos Contos
address: R. Rio Grande do Norte, 1065 - Savassi, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30130-130, Brazil

detail_description: The Igreja São Francisco de Assis, also known as the Church of San Francisco, is situated by the Pampulha Lagoon and stands out for its simple yet captivating architecture. Unlike other churches in the area, it boasts unique curved shapes and striking interior paintings. The church holds masses on Thursdays at 8:00 pm and Sundays at 10:00 am, 6:00 pm, and 8:00 pm.
name: Igreja São Francisco de Assis
address: Rua Dr. Sylvio Menicucci, 70 - Castelo, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30840-480, Brazil

excerpt: Belo Horizonte is the capital city of southeastern Brazil’s Minas Gerais state. Surrounded by mountains, the city’s known for the vast Mineirão Stadium. Built in 1965, the stadium also houses the Brazilian Football Museum. Nearby are Lake Pampulha and the Pampulha Architectural Complex, home to the wavy-topped Church of St. Francis of Assisi, designed by Brazil’s modernist architect Oscar Niemeyer.
detail_description: Belo Horizonte, the capital city of Minas Gerais in southeastern Brazil, is surrounded by picturesque mountains and is famous for its Mineirão Stadium, which also houses the Brazilian Football Museum. The city is home to the stunning Pampulha Architectural Complex and Lake Pampulha, where you can find the unique Church of St. Francis of Assisi designed by renowned architect Oscar Niemeyer. With a population of over 2.
name: Belo Horizonte
address: State of Minas Gerais, Brazil

detail_description: The Palladium is a theater located in the central region of Belo Horizonte. It offers courses and conferences about performing arts medicine, as well as dynamic activities for students. The theater itself is clean and richly decorated, with many seating options available. Highly recommended!
name: Sesc Palladium
address: R. Rio de Janeiro, 1046 - Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30160-041, Brazil

excerpt: Arts & crafts museum in a railway depot displaying artifacts & historic tools from Minas Gerais.
detail_description: The Arts and Crafts Museum in Belo Horizonte is a museum dedicated to artifacts and historical tools from the state of Minas Gerais. The exhibits cover a wide range of topics, from traditional Minas Gerais crafts such as alambiques (a type of distilling still) to aspects of regional history.
name: Arts and Crafts Museum
address: Praça Rui Barbosa, 600 - Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30160-000, Brazil

detail_description: Saturdays in Belo Horizonte, Brazil can be spent with family at the Natural History Museum and Botanical Garden UFMG. This beautiful place offers a peaceful atmosphere where visitors can relax and listen to the sounds of birds in one of the city's most picturesque areas. The staff is known for their exceptional hospitality, making it a must-visit destination recommended to all. Located in the heart of downtown, this museum provides a unique opportunity to enjoy nature amidst an urban setting.
name: Natural History Museum and Botanical Garden UFMG
address: R. Gustavo da Silveira, 1035 - Santa Ines, Belo Horizonte - MG, 31080-010, Brazil

excerpt: Consecrated in 1959, this unique modern Catholic chapel was designed by Oscar Niemeyer.
detail_description: Located on the shores of Pampulha Lagoon in Belo Horizonte, Brazil, Santuário Arquidiocesano São Francisco de Assis is a modern Catholic chapel designed by the renowned architect Oscar Niemeyer. Consecrated in 1959, this unique building features stylish curved lines and elegant contemporary architecture. Initially controversial for its design, it was not used as a place of worship for many years.
name: Santuário Arquidiocesano São Francisco de Assis
address: Avenida Otacílio Negrão de Lima, 3000 - Pampulha, Belo Horizonte - MG, 31365-450, Brazil

excerpt: Museum in a historic building displaying paintings, religious art & relics related to local history.
detail_description: The Mineiro Museum, located in the 'Cidade Jardim,' is a historical treasure dedicated to preserving Belo Horizonte's rich history. Housed in the 19th-century 'Casarao' building, it showcases paintings, religious art, and relics that offer insight into local history. The museum features works by renowned Mineiro artists such as Manoel da Costa Ataide and Jeanne Louise Milde.
name: Mineiro Museum
address: Av. João Pinheiro, 342 - Lourdes, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30130-180, Brazil

excerpt: Landmark building from 1914 hosting films, talks & exhibitions relating to the history of fashion.
detail_description: The Fashion Museum, also known as MUMO, is a historic building dating back to 1914 that offers a range of activities such as film screenings, discussions, and exhibitions centered around the rich history of fashion. As the first public museum in Brazil dedicated to this subject, it is an initiative led by the Belo Horizonte city hall and the Municipal Foundation of Culture.
name: Fashion Museum
address: R. da Bahia, 1149 - Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30160-011, Brazil

excerpt: This 101-m. tower offers event space, a restaurant & scenic views of the city & mountains.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant district of Nova Lima, Alta Vila Tower stands tall at 101 meters, offering visitors an unforgettable experience. The tower features a panoramic Sky Lounge restaurant that serves up stunning vistas of Belo Horizonte and the majestic mountains of Minas Gerais. It's not just about the views; you can also indulge in a meal at the popular Hard Rock Cafe located on the first floor.
name: Alta Vila Tower
address: R. Sen. Milton Campos, 145 - Vila da Serra, Nova Lima - MG, 34006-050, Brazil

excerpt: High-end fashion-focused mall on 3 levels with a 100-seat theater, 8-screen cinema & food court.
detail_description: Pátio Savassi is a high-end shopping complex located in the Funcionários neighborhood, boasting over 200 stores spread across three levels. It offers a diverse range of shops, including fashion outlets, pharmacies, and even a supermarket, providing visitors with comprehensive solutions for their everyday needs. Additionally, the mall features amenities such as a 100-seat theater and an eight-screen cinema managed by Cinemark.
name: Pátio Savassi
address: Av. do Contorno, 6061 - São Pedro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30110-929, Brazil

excerpt: Vibrant locale with sidewalk tables specializing in diverse variations on cheese bread.
detail_description: A Pão de Queijaria - Savassi is a vibrant locale with sidewalk tables that specializes in diverse variations of cheese bread. This place offers the beloved Brazilian delicacy in its traditional form, as well as stuffed versions, burgers, and even as a dessert. Visitors have praised the quality of the cheese bread and appreciated the friendly staff. The menu also includes other delicious options such as tinned beef shoulder and apple chutney.
name: A Pão de Queijaria - Savassi
address: R. Antônio de Albuquerque, 856 - Funcionários, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30112-011, Brazil

excerpt: Unfussy quarters in a straightforward hotel featuring a bar/restaurant & complimentary breakfast.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant Funcionarios district, TRYP by Wyndham Belo Horizonte Savassi offers a comfortable and uncomplicated stay for travelers. Just a stone's throw from popular attractions like Patio Savassi Mall and Liberty Square, this hotel is perfectly positioned to explore the city's highlights. Guests can enjoy complimentary breakfast each morning, along with access to free WiFi throughout the property.
name: TRYP by Wyndham Belo Horizonte Savassi
address: R. Gonçalves Dias, 30 - Funcionários, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30140-090, Brazil

excerpt: Sleek suites with balconies in a modernist tower offering an outdoor pool, a restaurant & a bar.
detail_description: Ramada by Wyndham Belo Horizonte Lourdes is a modernist tower offering sleek suites with balconies, an outdoor pool, a restaurant, and a bar. Located in the quiet Lourdes neighborhood near Belo Horizonte center, this hotel provides self-catering apartments with free WiFi and room service. The leisure area includes a fitness center, steam sauna, heated pool, and kid's area.
name: Ramada by Wyndham Belo Horizonte Lourdes
address: Av. Álvares Cabral, 967 - Lourdes, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30170-001, Brazil

excerpt: This popular cultural center offers performances, exhibitions & workshops, along with a cafe.
detail_description: Casa Fiat de Cultura is a renowned cultural center that forms part of the Cultural Circuit Freedom Circuit, alongside other museums and cultural centers. It plays a significant role in shaping the Brazilian cultural landscape by offering various performances, exhibitions, workshops, and a café for visitors to enjoy. The institution frequently hosts important exhibitions featuring both local and international painters. While it may be relatively small in size, it remains an intriguing destination for temporary shows and interpretations of masterpieces.
name: Casa Fiat de Cultura
address: Praça da Liberdade, 10 - Funcionários, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30140-010, Brazil

detail_description: In 1962, Belo Horizonte introduced Mercado Novo as a modern central market to reflect the city's contemporary vibe and cater to its growing educated population. Although it was meant to replace the old Central Market, the latter still stands as a city landmark. Today, Mercado Novo is a bustling marketplace with various businesses offering drinks, homemade beer, stylish haircuts, tattoos, piercings, clothing, art and gift items. It also features restaurants with diverse pricing.
name: Mercado Novo
address: R. Rio Grande do Sul, 499 - Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30180-916, Brazil

detail_description: The Museu de Mineralogia Prof Djalma Guimarães, also known as the 'Queen of Scrap Iron,' is housed in a striking postmodern building that was originally intended to be a tourist office. The museum boasts an impressive collection of nearly 3,000 minerals from mines in Minas Gerais and around the world, with around 800 of them on display.
name: Museu de Mineralogia Prof Djalma Guimarães
address: Av. Bias Fortes, 50 - Lourdes, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30160-017, Brazil

detail_description: Praça da Estação is a historic square located in the heart of downtown Belo Horizonte. During the day, it bustles with activity and is a great place to soak up the local atmosphere. However, it's important to be cautious at night as the area can become unsafe after dark. The square often hosts entertaining shows, adding to its vibrant energy during the day.
name: Praça da Estação
address: Av. dos Andradas, 337 - Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30120-010, Brazil

excerpt: Small airport opened in 1933 & offering flights to other Brazilian cities.
detail_description: Belo Horizonte/Pampulha Carlos Drummond de Andrade Airport is a small domestic airport in Brazil, offering flights to other cities within the country. Despite its small size, it provides modern conveniences such as duty-free shops and eateries like McDonald's and Burger King. The airport is neat and clean with helpful staff, although language barriers may be encountered as English isn't widely understood. It's well-connected to the city center and other places via public transport.
name: Belo Horizonte/Pampulha Carlos Drummond de Andrade Airport
address: Praça Bagatelle, 204 - São Luiz, Belo Horizonte - MG, 31270-705, Brazil

detail_description: Serra do Curral, located near Belo Horizonte, is home to the stunning Mangabeiras park. Just six kilometers from the city, this park offers breathtaking views of the capital and spans 2.35 million square meters, including 900,000 square meters of native forest. Additionally, in the vicinity lies the Mata do Jambeiro nature reserve which covers 912 hectares and boasts typical Atlantic Forest vegetation.
name: Serra do Curral
address: Belo Horizonte - State of Minas Gerais, Brazil

detail_description: When in the city center, make sure to explore Circuito Liberdade, a collection of 16 institutions housed in historic buildings. The area boasts numerous museums and cultural centers, many located within stunning palaces that form an impressive architectural ensemble. One such highlight is the eye-catching Liberty Palace, built in 1898. This historic site offers a glimpse into the history of Minas Gerais from various perspectives through its state-managed museums financed by the private sector.
name: Circuito Liberdade
address: Av. Bias Fortes, 50 - Lourdes, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30170-010, Brazil

name: Feira Hippie - Vânia Velloso Pintura Abstrata (Feira de Artes e Artesanato de Belo Horizonte)
address: Feira Hippie (Vânia Velloso Pintura Abstrata Quadros Abstratos - Feira de artes e artesanato de, Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30130-005, Brazil

excerpt: Cultural hub in a grand 1920s building featuring art exhibitions, films, plays, a cafe & a bookshop.
detail_description: Nestled in a stunning 1920s building on Praca da Liberdade, the Bank of Brazil Cultural Center is a vibrant cultural hotspot in Belo Horizonte. Since its inauguration in late 2013, this architectural gem has become a must-visit destination for art lovers and culture enthusiasts alike.
name: Bank of Brazil Cultural Center
address: Praça da Liberdade, 450 - Funcionários, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30140-010, Brazil

excerpt: Vibrant city square & meeting place surrounded by restaurants, bars & shops.
detail_description: Savassi Square is the heart of Belo Horizonte and a popular tourist attraction due to its vibrant city square surrounded by restaurants, bars, and shops. The square is close to some of the city's top attractions such as the Bank of Brazil Cultural Center, Parque Municipal Americo Renne Giannetti, and the Christ the Redeemer statue.
name: Savassi Square
address: R. Antônio de Albuquerque, 619 - Funcionários, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30112-011, Brazil

excerpt: Historic park with a tropical feel offering lakes with boat rentals & other recreational facilities.
detail_description: The City Park Américo Renné Giannetti is a large park in the center of Belo Horizonte that offers a variety of activities and landmarks. Among these are lakes with boat rentals, a playground, and birdwatching opportunities. The park also has a tropical feel, with palm trees and flowering plants adding to its natural beauty.
name: Américo Renné Giannetti City Park
address: Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30130-005, Brazil

excerpt: Bustling amusement park featuring classic rides including bumper cars & a giant ferris wheel.
detail_description: Parque Guanabara is a lively amusement park with classic rides like bumper cars and a giant ferris wheel. It's a great spot to spend half a day, offering more thrilling rides than typical fairs. However, some visitors have noted that certain major attractions were out of order during their visit. Despite this, the park provides entertainment for the whole family with diverse ride options. The Ferris wheel offers stunning views and evokes nostalgic childhood memories.
name: Parque Guanabara
address: Av. Expedicionário Benvindo Belém de Lima, 15 - São Luiz, Belo Horizonte - MG, 31310-040, Brazil

excerpt: Zoo with Japanese water gardens, a gorilla enclosure & reptile house, plus an aviary & aquarium.
detail_description: Zoobotânica (Jardim Zoológico e Jardim Botânico) de Belo Horizonte is a unique destination that combines a zoo, botanical garden, and aquarium. It features the largest freshwater aquarium in Brazil, showcasing the diverse life found in the Sao Francisco River basin. The zoo is committed to conservation, education, and animal welfare through partnerships with research institutions and educational programs.
name: Zoobotânica (Jardim Zoológico e Jardim Botânico) de Belo Horizonte
address: Av. Otacílio Negrão de Lima, 8000 - Pampulha, Belo Horizonte - MG, 31365-450, Brazil

excerpt: Public green space offering local flora & fauna & areas for sports & cultural performances.
detail_description: Nestled near the University of Minas Gerais, Pampulha Ecological Park is a stunning public green space that spans an impressive 300,000 square meters. This vibrant park showcases local flora and fauna while providing ample opportunities for sports and cultural performances. The nearby Pampulha Lagoon features the picturesque Hangover Island and is part of the UNESCO-listed Pampulha Architectural Ensemble, which includes iconic structures like the Church of St. Francis of Assisi, crafted by renowned Brazilian architect Oscar Niemeyer.
name: Pampulha Ecological Park
address: Av. Otacílio Negrão de Lima, 7111 - Pampulha, Belo Horizonte - MG, 31365-450, Brazil
